titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Orville Hickman Browning papers, 1866-1869
titlestmt.author: Processed by: Rubenstein Staff; EAD finding aid derived from MARC record using marc2ead_sectionA.xsl

profiledesc.creation: Finding aid derived from MARC record via marc2ead_sectionA.xsl, 2017

repository.label: Repository
repository.corpname: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University

did.abstract: Collection contains two letters dating from Browning's term as Secretary of the Interior under President Andrew Johnson. The first was written by Joseph H. Bradley, Sr., and is a recommendation letter for Henry A. Klopfer. The second letter was written by Browning to M.D. Phillips, referring Phillips to the Illinois Agricultural Society for information on agricultural resources.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: The copyright interests in this collection have not been transferred to Duke University. For more information, consult the copyright section of the Regulations and Procedures of the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library.

prefercite.p: Orville Hickman Browning Papers, 1866-1869, David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University.

processinfo.p: This finding aid was derived from a MARC record using a crosswalk defined in marc2ead_section.xsl. The finding aid was generated as part of a larger project to digitize several thousand small collections housed in Section A, January 2017.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: Illinois senator who filled the unexpired term of Stephen A. Douglas in the U.S. Senate. Also served as Secretary of the Interior under Andrew Johnson. Originally from Quincy, Adams Co., Ill.

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: Collection contains two letters dating from Browning's term as Secretary of the Interior under President Andrew Johnson. The first was written by Joseph H. Bradley, Sr., and is a recommendation letter for Henry A. Klopfer. The second letter was written by Browning to M.D. Phillips, referring Phillips to the Illinois Agricultural Society for information on agricultural resources.
